main event: An exceptionally bright light source was observed in Blue Ash, Ohio on 31 Oct 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as brilliant and oval in shape, resembling a bright star but much brighter., The sighting lasted approximately 30 minutes, with the object observed stationary for most of the time., Witnesses included eight individuals with astronomical experience., The object was observed using binoculars, which enhanced its brightness and clarity., A radar observer was contacted but was unable to establish any radar contact with the object.
sighted object: a brilliant oval light in the sky
